description: Composite and every divisor (except 1) contains the digit 7.
example: 799 has divisors 17, 47 and 799, all of which contain the digit 7
mathematica: fQ[n_, dgt_] := Union[ MemberQ[#, dgt] & /@ IntegerDigits@ Rest@ Divisors@ n][[1]]; Select[ Range[2, 7670], !PrimeQ[#] && fQ[#, 7] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 11 2014 *)
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jul 04 2001
